intro: Sesamum forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' sesame, is a species of flowering plant in the family Pedaliaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, oval seeds. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Sesamum forbesii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
